body:
I would go by it this way. Short explanation.

First you get the users. When this is done the users are stored on scope. Then repositories are populated with new requests for each user.

Here I've change the loading indicator to a number to allow for indication when all requests are done. The received repositories are written to the user object on the repos property. Do note that this is not compatible with your HTML so this needs some work, but you should get the picture.

I've changed the .success call, which is deprecated, to .then instead and outputs on error.

angular.module('app', [])
  .controller('gitHubDataController', ['$scope', '$http', function($scope, $http) {
    $scope.reposLoaded = 0;
    $scope.usersLoaded = false;

    $scope.predicate = '-updated_at';

    getUsers();

    function getUsers() {
      $http.get("https://api.github.com/users")
        .then(gotUsers, console.error);
    }

    function gotUsers(users) {
      $scope.users = users;
      $scope.usersLoaded = true;
      loadRepos();
    }

    function loadRepos() {
      for (var i = 0; i < $scope.users.length; i++) {
        $scope.reposLoaded++;
        $http.get($scope.users[i].repos_url)
          .then(gotRepos, console.error);
      }
    }

    function gotRepos(repos) {
      $scope.users[i].repos = repos;
      $scope.reposLoaded--;
    }
  }]);
title: How get github users api serching with an input using angularjs?
